description: Mobile techniques used by FluBot, ATT&CK software S1067 (v1.1)
name: FluBot (S1067)

techniques.comment: [FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can use HTTP POST requests on port 80 for communicating with its C2 server.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can use Domain Generation Algorithms to connect to the C2 server.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) has encrypted C2 message bodies with RSA and encoded them in base64.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can send contact lists to its C2 server.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can use `locale.getLanguage()` to choose the language for notifications and avoid user detection.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can use Accessibility Services to make removal of the malicious app difficult.(Citation: bitdefender_flubot_0524)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can disable Google Play Protect to prevent detection.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)(Citation: Europol FluBot Jun2022)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can add display overlays onto banking apps to capture credit card information.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can obfuscated class, string, and method names in newer malware versions.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) has been distributed via malicious links in SMS messages.(Citation: Europol FluBot Jun2022)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) has used the contact list to infect more devices.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)(Citation: Europol FluBot Jun2022)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can intercept SMS messages and USSD messages from Telcom operators.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can use a SOCKS proxy to evade C2 IP detection.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) can send SMS phishing messages to other contacts on an infected device.(Citation: proofpoint_flubot_0421)(Citation: bitdefender_flubot_0524)
[FluBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1067) has collected credentials, banking details and other information from the victim device.(Citation: Europol FluBot Jun2022)
